text: Favours, information, money, respect; all are commodities when it comes to politics. Use these resources sparingly to bend others to your will.
Reckless luck represents Sun Ce's brilliance and reckless nature, that risks eventually catching up with him
Fury represents the enthusiasm of this faction and the magnitude of its drive forward to conquest and glory.
To achieve one's ends, it is sometimes necessary to engage in acts of subterfuge.
The longer that Wild Fire remains confined, the greater the strain will be man and god alike.
{{tr:dlc04_term_regional_fervour}} is the amount the population of this area believe in the Yellow Turban cause. Learn to harness it, then wield it as you would a blade.
A strong emperor is a strong empire, but the warlords and governors within the Han may not appreciate you centralising power.
Reformation of ideals is the first step towards true societal progression.
Turbulent times call for radical measures, a reformation of the old ways to lead the people into a brighter future.
For every enemy defeated, the flame of Lü Bu's rage grows and grows until it swallows the world whole.
Intimidating acts of domination and power instill fear, and begrudging respect.
For each character defeated by your faction leader's army, your strength increases – but so does the envy and suspicion of others.
Imperial authority is displayed through acts of domination, power and brutality.
It represents the size and quality of Yan Baihu's cross-faction collaboration efforts
The pride of this tribe is only matched by their virtue on the battlefield.
Influence represents how much authority and control this faction leader has within his own government and within the administration of his faction.
Fame and fortune represent recognition of your services on the battlefield as a mercenary. Should you fail in your commitments, your contract will be void.
With bravery and discipline, Liu Chong inspires his men and puts fear into the enemies of the imperial palace.
{{tr:dlc04_term_fervour}} is the amount of impassioned support you have amongst your followers. Keep this flame burning strong, honing it into a spear to pierce your enemies.
A respected name, tied to respected lineage, can provide opportunities many others would not be afforded.
Your population are the people living in your settlements and surrounding countryside. High population will increase peasantry income and army replenishment.
Conquest is the mark of a great commander, but possibly also a tyrant.
The fortitude of Liu Chong rewards those with brave hearts and honest intentions.
Wild Fire is burning, giving Zhurong and her forces untold power. Yet it cannot burn indefinitely, and the more time progresses, the more it will strain the armies, and Zhurong.
One's domain cannot outreach one's jurisdiction, lest order succumb to chaos.
A popular leader is a dangerous one. Beware the one who unifies many under one banner.
Unity is a leader's strength to pull people together and keep them together, to better seize their ideals.
The favour of the emperor leads to strong diplomatic influence.
Momentum is gained by defeating enemy characters and armies with your faction leader's army. The more of it you have, the faster it decays.
Splendour represents the growing commercial, cultural, and scholarly power of the Shi south.
Experience and knowledge are like torches in the night; by placing them together a great bonfire can be made, enlightening us all.

Food is a key resource generated by specific buildings, such as farms and fisheries; it can also be obtained through diplomatic trading. Food shortage across your territories will lead to local reserves being depleted. This will reduce military supply recovery for your armies and can cause {{tr:food_tooltip_public_order}} issues.
One's domain cannot outreach one's governance, lest order succumb to chaos.
Much can be said for jurisdiction earned through just and honourable means.
Absolute control is the hand that keeps the wheels of government turning, and the ambitions of lesser people in check!
A domain to match one's lawful jursidiction; a princedom to match one's right to rule.
China is its people, and you are the steward to many.
Infamy instils respect in your enemies and measures the success of your exploits.
To govern is to be subject to the laws of the Han – without their approval any expansion will be treated as an affront against the empire itself!
The flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
Cohesion and unity are the seeds from which a new dynasty will grow. A new age of hope will not be built on the fragile foundation of a divided realm.
Zhurong's fury is the inferno given human form - born of deific power, she sets ablaze all before her in an unending conflagration!
Heroic leadership inspires great deeds from the people.
A domain to match one's lawful governance; a realm to match one's right to rule.
Those who believe themselves the legitimate rulers of China must still prove themselves to others – this is the measure of success for achieving legitimacy.
The display of heroic leadership will inspire troops and people alike, yielding a great fortune for your realm.
Legitimacy proves worthiness to others; the right to rule!
China has reaped the benefits of bureacracy for centuries, but a seed of chaos has taken root within the court.
Wild Fire is the inferno given human form – in Zhurong.
Fury represents the enthusiasm of this faction and the magnitude of its drive forward to conquest and glory.
Infamy creates respect; an able measure of one's exploits!
Subterfuge is the secret weapon to which all will succumb, should Sima Lun have his way.
Influence represents the amount of authority and control this faction leader has within his own government and within the administration of his faction.
A mercenary lives and dies by their reputation. Nurture it, and grow it, and the coin will surely flow.
The pride of your faction is increasing with every defeated enemy.
White Tiger Yan understands that by standing side-by-side, the disenfranchised and the downtrodden can overcome even the greatest of adversity.
Co-operation provides increasing bonuses for each Nanman tribe you vassalise.
This faction's credibility determines its diplomatic influence.
Sima Liang's claim to the regency has been usurped by his ambitious kin – only by re-establishing his lawful jurisdiction over the people can he hope to restore order to the Jin Empire!

The illustrious lineage of the Yuan family can open doors and create opportunities. For the common soldier, the lineage of Yuan Shao and his descendants is a flame of inspiration; a flame that demands to be fuelled with courage and prestige.
Domination provides increasing bonuses for each Nanman tribe confederated.
The favour of the imperial court can be a blessing to the emperor's friend, but a curse to his enemies.
Ensure the satisfaction of your subjects, and you ensure a clearer path to victory.
Empowering the warlords and governors will strengthen the Han Empire against external threats. However, it may also risk developing new threats from within...
Governance brings the weight of the Han government behind it.
Reserves can be stored to support settlements in dire times of food shortages, to re-supply local armies, or to increase hold-out time of {{tr:map_province}} capitals during a siege.
Maintain control and you avert the chaos that others trail in their wake!
Aspiration represents this faction's willingness to do whatever it takes to succeed. It can be used to enable a variety of faction bonuses.
Credibility represents the diplomatic respect and influence of this faction. It can be used to manipulate and influence others in diplomacy.
Splendour represents the growing commercial, cultural, and scholarly power of the Shi South.
